html:
Updates

** Shares of EV startup RIVN.O fall as much as 16.5% to record low of $75.13 in early trading, after rising ~1% premarket

** Including session's losses, RIVN lost 3.6% from its Nov. 10 IPO price of $78

** RIVN had closed over 11% lower on Wednesday after one of its biggest investors, Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O, said it would collaborate with Stellantis NV STLA.MI to develop cars, trucks with AMZN's software in the dashboards, and deploy its electric vans (Full Story)

** AMZN previously agreed to buy up to 100,000 of Rivian's electric delivery vans and it also has exclusive rights to RIVN's vans for four years, according to a regulatory filing from October

** Meanwhile other EV stocks Tesla Inc TSLA.O down ~4%, Fisker FSR.N loses 3.3%, Nikola NKLA.O is up 0.3%, Lucid LCID.O is down 5%

** So far this week, market participants have rotated out of technology-heavy growth shares; tech-heavy Nasdaq .IXIC plunged more than 3% on Wednesday, its biggest one-day percentage drop since February, after minutes from the Fed's December meeting signaled the possibility of sooner-than-expected rate hikes and stimulus withdrawal to curb inflation (Full Story)



(Reporting by Akash Sriram and Eva Mathews in Bengaluru)

(( Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ;))
